metadata.titel_preek: The Little Church in the Wilderness—1 Kings 17

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God humbles and prepares His prophet and His people through a 'wilderness' experience to sustain His Word in a hostile world.

tekstueel_bewijs: God comes to him and instructs him to go
God did not allow Elijah to become intoxicated with his own greatness
the marvellous disposal of divine Providence

object.identificatie: The preservation of the 'Living Word' and the humbling of the Church/Prophet
tekstueel_bewijs: the true Word that he had put into Elijah’s mouth
the Lord’s hard way of teaching us our place before him

zender.identificatie: The Living God (as the source of the Word)
tekstueel_bewijs: As the Lord the God of Israel lives, before whom I stand

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church (Elijah, the Widow, and the modern congregation)
tekstueel_bewijs: the angels of God have rejoiced... over this little church in the wilderness

helper.identificatie: The Widow of Zarephath / The Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: the Spirit guided Elijah to this particular woman
God has prepared her heart to receive Elijah
intoxicated with his newly proven capacities
the power behind the throne... Jezebel
there was no breath left in him
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just political (Jezebel) but ontological (death) and spiritual (the pride of the prophet).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church's witness to the world and social justice.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Telling truth to power / Social justice
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical witness (Program 2) is explicitly grounded in standing before the Living God (Program 1).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Living God → The Living Word → The Little Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Widow/Spirit → The Living God ← Human Pride/Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God comes to him and instructs him
God restored the boy to health
God did not allow Elijah to become intoxicated
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you have a tradition of biblical preaching
we start thinking that this human activity is what drives the engine

voorbeelden: He in his turn must be brought low
The world is looking for the compassion
God would give her the means to provide
the power of the same God who many centuries later will feed five thousand

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' to act where humans are 'unable' (famine, death, pride).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false power of Elijah/Ahab (~S2) to the reality of the drought (S2), then to the intervention of the Living God (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God intervenes in the 'wilderness' where human resources (~S1) have failed.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and starvation are treated as real limits that only God can cross.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly critiques anthropocentric 'human programs' and insists on God as the active Subject of history.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We can think of Elijah as representing the public face of the church

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the marvellous disposal of divine Providence
we start thinking that this human activity is what drives the engine of the church

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Elijah is presented not as a hero to imitate, but as a 'muscle man' who had to be humbled by God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God uses the weak to humble the strong.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and dependence on God rather than pressure to perform.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the biblical narrative to the modern church context is seamless and structurally consistent.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'prominent/prosperous' and 'little church in the wilderness'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God who actively intervenes... who judges and redeems

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit prepares the heart and guides the feet.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; pride is seen as a fatal intoxication.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's power)
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue emphasizing that God 'makes a way'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of moralism by making God the protagonist of both the biblical text and the modern church's life.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Trojan Horse' metaphor, Greimas shows how the actantial roles shift from Elijah-as-Subject to God-as-Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the historical context of 1 Kings to show the universal grammar of how God humbles His instruments.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Widow' is a Helper actant sent by the Sender (God) to the Subject (Elijah) to achieve the Object (Humility/Survival).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Krummacher as a 'Helper' in the narrative of the sermon itself.
